Posts.Content: Mar 8, 2019 09:22PM Cindr wrote: I'm new to the Stage 1 family. Original biopsy showed left breast DCIS, grade 2. After lumpectomy i was then diagnosis with Stage 1, grade 2. 4mm tumor. Original tumor, prior to biopsy was 8mm. Having sentinel node surgery next Wednesday since nodes were not taken during lumpectomy üòû RO giving me the choice of Acceleraled partial breast radiation or full breast radiation as long as nodes are clear. I really don't know what to do!! Please help! Any experiences with partial breast radiation would be really helpful. I really don't know what to do üò¢ Thank you!!

Posts.Content: Mar 21, 2019 09:31PM Cindr wrote: Hi 60notpretty ( although I am sure you are pretty!) üòä I had my sentinel node surgery one week ago. 2 nodes removed. Praise God, the nodes were negative! My issue is I have a large lump under my arm from the surgery. Very tender and hard to the touch. Not sure what’s going on! Going to see my BS tomorrow. Hoping this is nothing serious although it’s definitely gotten worse since his surgery. I’ll also be seeing MO tomorrow to discuss hormone therapy Really not wanting to go down that road. But everyone is telling me I need to at least try, so I will üòÉ Seeing my RO next Wednesday, hoping they will do a CT and start planning for hypofractional full breast radiation. üôèüèªü§ûüèª I’m worried this lump may slow down my treatment. Just feeling like I want to get all of this done and over with so I can get on with my life. Hoping your path comes back negative. Cindr

Posts.Content: Mar 22, 2019 06:28PM Cindr wrote: Hi Jules, Right! It’s on my BS today and it was a large Seroma- 2 pockets. She had to drain it. Feels better. I guess it’s a 50-50 chance it will come back keep my fingers crossed üòÉü§ûüèª Hoping and praying this doesn’t slow down the beginning of RAD! I really would like to get this done and over with so I can get back to my life!! ü§™ Loved the MO is met today! So glad I got a 2nd opinion. She wants to put me on an AI after RADS. She’s very willing to work with me find the right medication for me. She understands how nervous I am about going on a hormone inhibitor üò≥. So onward we go!! Wishing you a fun filled weekend!! Cibd

Posts.Content: Cindr wrote: Hello all you BRAVE ladies! I finished my RADS on April 26th (15 treatments . I got a bit of a cold right after I finished. Then I got a persistent cough. Dry cough got worse and now I have lost my voice (which has NEVER happened). Very tired. Has anyone else experienced this?? I’m wondering if I could develop radiation pneumontis this quickly?? Thank you for your help XXOO Log in to post a reply
